docs.snippet: The Royal Mail Steamship Africa, now in her twelfth day from Liverpool, with two days later European advices, is fully due. Nothing had been seen of her at Sandy Hook at 2' o'clock this morning.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Royal Mail Steamship Africa, now in her twelfth day from Liverpool, with two days later European advices, is fully due. Nothing had been seen of her at Sandy Hook at 2' o'clock this morning.

docs.snippet: DEPARTURE OF JUSTICE WELSH FOR EUROPE.--Among the passengers by the Asia, which left this port yesterday for Liverpool, was Justice JAMES H. WELSH, who seeks renovation of impaired health in a few months absence from the cares of office. A gratifying...
docs.lead_paragraph: DEPARTURE OF JUSTICE WELSH FOR EUROPE.--Among the passengers by the Asia, which left this port yesterday for Liverpool, was Justice JAMES H. WELSH, who seeks renovation of impaired health in a few months absence from the cares of office. A gratifying testimony to this merits and the affection with which he is regarded by his fellow citizens was afforded on the occasion.

docs.snippet: The arrival of the steamship Ariel places us in possession of correspondence and files of continental papers, from which we derive additional and highly interest intelligence. WAR NEWS AT PARIS.

headline.main: ADDITIONAL FROM EUROPE.; Interesting Correspondence and Details.

docs.lead_paragraph: The arrival of the steamship Ariel places us in possession of correspondence and files of continental papers, from which we derive additional and highly interest intelligence. WAR NEWS AT PARIS.

docs.snippet: Blackwood's Magazine for July, re-published by LECNARD, SCOTT  Co, contains an article on Sentimental Physiology, being a review of MICHELET'S PAmour, from: which we make the following extract on the Cockneyism of the Parisians. The faith of the...
docs.lead_paragraph: Blackwood's Magazine for July, re-published by LECNARD, SCOTT Co, contains an article on Sentimental Physiology, being a review of MICHELET'S PAmour, from: which we make the following extract on the Cockneyism of the Parisians. The faith of the Parisians in Paris is by no means the exclusive property of Frenchmen: Americans, Englishmen and Russians, share in the sentiment. It is a fanaticism founded in good reason:

docs.snippet: The President has recognized EMIL CHRISTIAN HAMMER as Vice-Consul of Denmark for the State of Massachusetts, to reside at Boston. The British and Spanish Ministers are preparing to leave the city, for the purpose of visiting the Summer resorts in the...

headline.main: NEWS BY TELEGRAPH.; MOVEMENTS OF THE DIPLOMATIC CORPS--ADJOURNMENT OF THE COURT OF CLAIMS--THE NEXT CENSUS--THE INDIAN TROUBLES, &C. From Washington.

docs.lead_paragraph: The President has recognized EMIL CHRISTIAN HAMMER as Vice-Consul of Denmark for the State of Massachusetts, to reside at Boston. The British and Spanish Ministers are preparing to leave the city, for the purpose of visiting the Summer resorts in the North.

docs.snippet: GOVERNORS OF THE ALMSHOUSE--The weekly statement of the Governors of the Almshouse gives 7,092 as the number of inmates in the different institutions, being an increase during the week of 40. Since July 9, 39 have died; 1,500 have been discharged;...
docs.lead_paragraph: GOVERNORS OF THE ALMSHOUSE--The weekly statement of the Governors of the Almshouse gives 7,092 as the number of inmates in the different institutions, being an increase during the week of 40. Since July 9, 39 have died; 1,500 have been discharged; III have been sent to the Penitentiary; 8 to the State Prison, and 1,758 have been admitted.

docs.snippet: Mr DEAR WHITBREAD: Some few months ago we were speaking of the cases of cruelty on shipboard, which the newspapers had reported, and you asked me whether anything could be done to prevent their repetition. The subject is most involved and difficult,...

headline.main: THE MERCHANT SERVICE.; Important Letter of Liverpool Merchant to Samuel Whitbread, M. P., Respecting the Unpunished Cruelties upon the High Seas. LIVERPOOL, Friday, May 20, 1859.

docs.lead_paragraph: Mr DEAR WHITBREAD: Some few months ago we were speaking of the cases of cruelty on shipboard, which the newspapers had reported, and you asked me whether anything could be done to prevent their repetition. The subject is most involved and difficult, and I cannot enter into it t length.

docs.snippet: ACADEMY OF THE VISITATINON.-The Annual distribution of prizes to the pupils of the Academy of the Visitation, in Johnson-street, took place on Thursday last. The Academy is under the care of the Sisters of the.Visitation, a religious society attached...
docs.lead_paragraph: ACADEMY OF THE VISITATINON.-The Annual distribution of prizes to the pupils of the Academy of the Visitation, in Johnson-street, took place on Thursday last. The Academy is under the care of the Sisters of the.Visitation, a religious society attached to the Roman Catholic Church, and is in a prosperous condition.

docs.snippet: Father Chiniquy writes to a friend in this City, under date of July 14, in a desponding strain. He says: "I am going back to my little colony with a truly broken heart. I have not been able to sleep a single moment this night, having constantly...
docs.lead_paragraph: Father Chiniquy writes to a friend in this City, under date of July 14, in a desponding strain. He says: "I am going back to my little colony with a truly broken heart. I have not been able to sleep a single moment this night, having constantly before my eyes the imminent ruin of my dear colony."

docs.snippet: To the Editor of the New-York Times: An American traveler not long since visited some of the Institutions for the Deaf and Dumb in Europe, and on his return to this country, published an account of the wonderful art, lately discovered, of teaching...

headline.main: Instruction of the Deaf and Dumb--Teaching Articulation.

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor of the New-York Times: An American traveler not long since visited some of the Institutions for the Deaf and Dumb in Europe, and on his return to this country, published an account of the wonderful art, lately discovered, of teaching Deaf Mutes to speak and to hold conversation orally with others.
